result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markus Poschung

defendant.name: Poschung, Markus
defendant.address: W277 N1310 Spring Hill Dr, Pewaukee, WI 53072

records.addlTxt: Filed by the State.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:37 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Markus Poschung.  Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Wolff provides an update; he just received an offer but needs time to review it with his client.  Atty. Wolff requests another further proceedings date.  Court notes at the last hearing it was noted that an offer was received.  Atty. Wolff is requesting the matter then be set for plea and sentencing about 45 days out.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:08 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Brandon Carlson, for attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Markus Poschung.  Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Carlson provides an update, he just received the pretrial offer and needs time to review.  Atty. Carlson requests a further proceeding date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:36 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Markus Poschung did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he still does not have discovery or an offer so he is requesting another further proceedings date in about 30 days.  State is providing the pretrial offer to Atty. Wolff today and will route the file to make sure discovery is provided to Atty. Wolff as well.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:39 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Brandon Carlson, for attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Markus Poschung did not appear.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Carlson provides an update, he is asking for further proceedings in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing on June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:21 AM Defendant Markus Poschung in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
